cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles north of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast, forecast to parallel the west coast of Florida, make landfall near Apalachee Bay, then move inland across Georgia/Alabama toward the southeast U.S. interior
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Apalachee Bay, FL (Florida Big Bend)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Englewood FL northward to Suwannee River FL (west coast of Florida)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: West coast of Florida, Florida Keys, Apalachee Bay region, inland Alabama and Georgia
weather_observation.wind: Breezy northeasterly winds possible, generally below tropical-storm force (<34 kt)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the South Carolina coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain bands possible (generally <2 inches)
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated surf and rip-current risk along the Southeast Atlantic beaches
